00001 /*
00002  *  objvec.h - varaiable length storage classes for Objective-C
00003  *  ========

00010  *
00011  *  C++ classes to wrap up XCode classes for operator overload of
00012  *  useful operations such as access to NSArrays and NSDictionary
00013  *  by subscript or NSString operators such as + for concatenation.
00014  *
00015  *  This works as the Apple Objective-C compiler supports source
00016  *  which mixes C++ with objective C. To enable this: for each
00017  *  source file which will include/import this header file, select
00018  *  it in Xcode and open it's "Info". To enable mixed compilation,
00019  *  for the file's "File Type" select: "sourcecode.cpp.objcpp".
00020  *
00021  *  For bugs or ommisions please email objcpp@johnholdsworth.com

00051 #import "objcpp.h"

00053 static struct { int buffered; } _objvec;
00054 
00055 /*====================================================================================*/
00056 /*============================== Variable length buffer===============================*/
00057 
00058 /**
00059  Internal class to allocate storage on demand as it is accessed by ref using the
00060  subscript operator. A memory is allocated and reallocated if the element type is a
00061  plain type it will be zeroed out otherwise if it is a class the constructor will
00062  be called for each element in the array as it is allocated. On reallocation a new
00063  oversized array is allocated then the "=" operator used to copy the old values
00064  to the new array. This operator should "steal" any deep _refs from the old
00065  instance before it is detructed as does the OOBuffer class itself as it is used
00066  recursively.
00067  
00068  Usage:
00069  </pre>
00070  OOBuffer<OOBuffer<double> > x; // not ref counted however
00071  // and can not be put into arrays or dictionaries
00072  x[99][99] = 43;
00073  </pre>
00074  */
00075 
00076 template <typename ETYPE>
00077 class OOBuffer {
00078     ETYPE *buff;
00079     void realloc( int size ) {
00080         ETYPE *next = new ETYPE[size];
00081         const char *info = @encode(ETYPE);
00082         if ( info[0] != '{' )
00083             memset( next, '\000', size * sizeof *next );
00084         OOTrace( @"0x%08x %s [%d] 0x%08x = 0x%08x %s", this, "BREALLOC", size, buff, next, info );
00085         if ( buff ) {
00086             for ( int i=0 ; i<allocated ; i++ )
00087                 next[i] = buff[i];
00088             delete[] buff;
00089         }
00090         allocated = size;
00091         buff = next;
00092     }
00093     
00094 public:
00095     int used, allocated, bounds;
00096     
00097     oo_inline OOBuffer() {
00098         _objvec.buffered++;
00099         buff = NULL;
00100         used = allocated = bounds = 0;
00101         OOTrace( @"0x%08x %s", this, "BCONSTRUCT" );
00102     }
00103     oo_inline OOBuffer( int size ) {
00104         _objvec.buffered++;
00105         buff = NULL;
00106         realloc( bounds = size );
00107         used = 0;
00108         OOTrace( @"0x%08x %s [%d] 0x%08x", this, "BCONSTRUCT", size, buff );
00109     }
00110     oo_inline ETYPE &operator [] ( int sub ) {
00111         // reallocate?
00112         if ( !buff || sub+1 > allocated )
00113             realloc( (sub+11)*4/3 );
00114         
00115         // update elements used
00116         if ( used < sub+1 )
00117             used = sub+1;
00118         else if ( sub < 0 )
00119             sub += bounds ? bounds : used;
00120         else if ( bounds && sub+1 > bounds )
00121             OOWarn( @"0x%08x Subscript [%d] beyond bounds of array (%d)", this, sub, bounds );
00122         return buff[sub];
00123     }
00124     
00125     // steal pointer to contents when copied on reallocate of parent
00126     oo_inline OOBuffer &operator = ( OOBuffer & from ) {
00127         OOTrace( @"0x%08x %s, 0x%08x = 0x%08x", this, "BASSIGN", buff, from.buff );
00128         buff = from.buff;
00129         used = from.used;
00130         allocated = from.allocated;
00131         bounds = from.bounds;
00132         from.buff = NULL;
00133         return *this;
00134     }
00135     oo_inline ~OOBuffer() {
00136         _objvec.buffered--;
00137         if( buff ) {
00138             OOTrace( @"0x%08x %s 0x%08x", this, "BDESTRUCT", buff );
00139             delete[] buff;
00140         }
00141     }
00142 };
00143 
00144 /*====================================================================================*/
00145 /*============================== Pointer classes =====================================*/
00146 
00147 /**
00148  OOPointer subclass to store a pointer to a heap allocated C++ class instance
00149  inside an NSValue object to it can be ref counted and stored in OSX
00150  buffs such as NSMutableDictionary.
00151  
00152  Usage:
00153  <pre>
00154  OOClassPtr<aclass> avar = new aclass();
00155  OODictionary<OOClassPtr<aclass>> a dict;
00156  dict[@"KEY"] = avar;
00157  ~avar;
00158  ~dict[@"KEY"]; // instance deleted here
00159  </pre>
00160  */
00161 
00162 template <typename CNAME>
00163 class OOClassPtr : public OOPointer<CNAME *> {
00164 protected:
00165     oo_inline NSValue *cset( NSValue *val ) {
00166         if ( !!*this && val != this->get() )
00167             cdetruct();
00168         return this->pset( val );
00169     }
00170     oo_inline CNAME &cset( CNAME *cptr ) {
00171         if ( !!*this && cptr != this->pget() )
00172             cdetruct();
00173         return *pset( cptr );
00174     }
00175     oo_inline CNAME &calloc() {
00176         if ( !this->pget() ) {
00177             OOTrace( @"0x%08x %s", this, "CALLOC" );
00178             cset( new CNAME() );
00179         }
00180         return *this->pget();
00181     }
00182     oo_inline void cdetruct() {
00183         if ( this->pget() && [this->get() retainCount] == 1 ) {
00184             OOTrace( @"0x%08x %s", this, "CDESTOY" );
00185             delete this->pget();
00186         }
00187         this->detruct();
00188     }
00189 public:
00190     oo_inline OOClassPtr() {}
00191     oo_inline OOClassPtr( CNAME *cptr ) { *this = cptr; }
00192     oo_inline OOClassPtr( CNAME &cptr ) { *this = &cptr; }
00193     oo_inline OOClassPtr( NSValue *val ) { *this = val; }
00194     oo_inline OOClassPtr( const OOClassPtr &val ) { *this = val.get(); }
00195     oo_inline ~OOClassPtr() { cdetruct(); }
00196     
00197     oo_inline OOClassPtr &operator = ( CNAME *cptr ) { cset( cptr ); return *this;  }
00198     oo_inline OOClassPtr &operator = ( CNAME &cptr ) { cset( &cptr ); return *this; }
00199     oo_inline OOClassPtr &operator = ( NSValue *val ) { cset( val ); return *this; }
00200     oo_inline OOClassPtr &operator = ( const OOClassPtr &val ) { cset( val.get() ); return *this; }
00201     
00202     oo_inline CNAME &cget() { return calloc(); } 
00203     oo_inline CNAME &operator * () { return calloc(); }         
00204     
00205     oo_inline OOClassPtr<CNAME> operator ~ () {
00206         OOClassPtr<CNAME> save = *this;
00207         this->detruct();
00208         return save;
00209     }   
00210 };
00211 
00212 /*===================================================================================*/
00213 /*=============================== Storage classes ===================================*/
00214 
00215 /**
00216  A more efficient buff class than NSArray for any element type (int, id, OOReference<NSString> etc.).
00217  Memory is allocated on deamnd when _refd by the subscipt operator and if the type is a class
00218  its constructors and destructors will be called by the underlying OOBuffer class.
00219  
00220  Usage:
00221  <pre>
00222  OOVector<double> array;
00223  array[99] = 43.
00224  OOVector<OOString> strarry;
00225  array[99] = @"THIS";
00226  </pre>
00227  */
00228 
00229 template <typename ETYPE>
00230 class OOVector : public OOClassPtr< OOBuffer<ETYPE> > {
00231 public:
00232     oo_inline OOVector() { }
00233     oo_inline OOVector( const OOVector &val ) { *this = val; }
00234     ///oo_inline OOVector( OOClassPtr<OOVector<ETYPE> > &val ) { *this = val.cget(); }
00235     oo_inline OOVector( int size ) { cset( new OOBuffer<ETYPE>( size ) ); }
00236     oo_inline OOVector( const OOArray<ETYPE> &array ) { 
00237         int size = (int)array;
00238         cset( new OOBuffer<ETYPE>( size ) ); 
00239         for ( int i=0 ; i<size ; i++ )
00240             (*this)[i] = array[i];
00241     }
00242 
00243     oo_inline OOVector &operator = ( NSValue *val ) { this->cset( val ); return *this; }
00244     oo_inline OOVector &operator = ( const OOVector &val ) { cset( val.get() ); return *this; }
00245 
00246     oo_inline operator int () { 
00247         return this->cget().used;
00248     }
00249     oo_inline ETYPE &operator [] ( int sub ) {
00250         return this->cget()[ sub ];
00251     }
00252     oo_inline OOVector &operator += ( ETYPE value ) {
00253         (*this)[this->cget().used] = value;
00254         return *this;
00255     }
00256 };

00264 public:

00266     oo_inline OOMatrix( const OOMatrix &val ) { *this = val; }
00267     
00268     oo_inline OOMatrix &operator = ( NSValue *val ) { this->cset( val ); return *this; }
00269     oo_inline OOMatrix &operator = ( const OOMatrix<ETYPE> &val ) { cset( val.get() ); return *this; }
00270 };

00273  A three dimensional Container class of any size using a OOVector of OOBuffers of OOBuffers.

00275 
00276 template <typename ETYPE>
00277 class OOCube : public OOVector< OOBuffer< OOBuffer<ETYPE> > > {
00278 public:
00279     oo_inline OOCube() { }
00280     oo_inline OOCube( const OOCube &val ) { *this = val; }
00281     oo_inline OOCube &operator = ( NSValue *val ) { this->cset( val ); return *this; }
00282     oo_inline OOCube &operator = ( const OOCube &val ) { cset( val.get() ); return *this; }
00283 };
00284 
00285 /**
00286  A faster NSMutableArray replacement that correctly ref counts and releases Objective-C objects.
00287  
00288  Usage:
00289  <pre>
00290  OOObjects<NSString *> var;
00291  var[99] = @"THIS";
00292  </pre>
00293  */
00294 
00295 template <typename RTYPE>
00296 class OOObjects : public OOVector< OOReference<RTYPE> > {
00297 public:
00298     oo_inline OOObjects() { }
00299     oo_inline OOObjects( int size ) { cset(  new OOBuffer< OOReference<RTYPE> >( size ) ); }
00300     oo_inline OOObjects( const OOArray<RTYPE> array ) { *this = array.get(); }
00301     oo_inline OOObjects( NSMutableArray *arr ) { *this = arr; }
00302     oo_inline OOObjects( const OOObjects &val ) { *this = val; }
00303     
00304     oo_inline OOObjects &operator = ( NSValue *val ) { this->cset( val ); return *this; }
00305     oo_inline OOObjects &operator = ( const OOObjects &val ) { cset( val.get() ); return *this; }
00306     oo_inline OOObjects &operator = ( NSMutableArray *array ) {
00307         for ( int i=0 ; i<[array count] ; i++ )
00308             (*this)[i] = [array objectAtIndex:i];
00309         return *this;
00310     }
00311     
00312     oo_inline NSMutableArray *array() {
00313         OOBuffer<OOReference<RTYPE> > &buff = this->cget();
00314         int count = buff.bounds ? buff.bounds : buff.used;
00315         OOArray<RTYPE> array( count );
00316         for ( int i=0 ; i<count ; i++ )
00317             array += buff[i];
00318         return &array;
00319     }
00320     oo_inline operator NSMutableArray * () { return array(); }
00321     oo_inline operator OOArray<RTYPE> () { return array(); }
00322 };

00324 /**
00325  A fast container for an array of strings.
00326  <pre>
00327  OOStrings ted;
00328  ted[99] <<= @"Go on ";
00329  ted[99] *= 10; 
00330  </pre>
00331  */
00332 
00333 class OOStrings : public OOVector< OOString > {
00334 public:
00335     oo_inline OOStrings() {}
00336     oo_inline OOStrings( NSMutableArray *arr ) { *this = arr; }
00337     oo_inline OOStrings( const OOStrings &val ) { *this = val; }
00338     oo_inline OOStrings( const OOStringArray &array ) { *this = array.get(); }
00339     
00340     oo_inline OOStrings &operator = ( NSValue *val ) { this->cset( val ); return *this; }
00341     oo_inline OOStrings &operator = ( const OOStrings &val ) { cset( val.get() ); return *this; }
00342     oo_inline OOStrings &operator = ( NSMutableArray *array ) {
00343         for ( int i=0 ; i<[array count] ; i++ )
00344             (*this)[i] = [array objectAtIndex:i];
00345         return *this;
00346     }
00347     
00348     oo_inline NSMutableArray *array() {
00349         OOBuffer<OOString> &buff = this->cget();
00350         int count = buff.bounds ? buff.bounds : buff.used;
00351         OOArray<OOString> array( count );
00352         for ( int i=0 ; i<count ; i++ )
00353             array += buff[i];
00354         return &array;
00355     }
00356     oo_inline operator OOStringArray () { return array(); }
00357 };

00359 /*===============================================================================*/
00360 /*============================== Class containers ===============================*/
00361 
00362 /**
00363  A wrapper for an array of heap allocated C++ class pointers stored as NSValue objects.
00364  
00365  Usage:
00366  <pre>
00367  \@interface ExampleClass {
00368  OOClassArray<aclass> CPPinstances;
00369  }
00370  
00371  \@implementation 
00372  
00373  - function {
00374  for ( int i=0 ; i<100 ; i+=10 )
00375  CPPinstances[i] = new aclass();
00376  ~CPPinstances; /// instances are deleted
00377  }
00378  
00379  \@end
00380  
00381  - function {
00382  OOClassArray<aclass> x;
00383  x[99] = new aclass();
00384  } // instance deleteed 
00385  
00386  </pre>
00387  */
00388 
00389 template <typename CNAME>
00390 class OOClassArray : public OOArray<OOClassPtr<CNAME> > {
00391 protected:
00392     // delete each element to call its destructor
00393     oo_inline NSMutableArray *set( NSMutableArray *val ) {
00394         NSMutableArray *old = !*this ? nil : this->get();
00395         if ( old && val != old && [old retainCount] == 1 )
00396             while ( [this->get() count] )
00397                 ~(*this)[-1];
00398         return OOArray<OOClassPtr<CNAME> >::set( val );
00399     }
00400     oo_inline void detruct() { set( nil ); }
00401 public:
00402     oo_inline OOClassArray() {}
00403     oo_inline OOClassArray( NSMutableArray *val ) { set( val ); }
00404     oo_inline OOClassArray( const OOClassArray &val ) { set( val.get() ); }
00405     oo_inline ~OOClassArray() { this->detruct(); }
00406     
00407     oo_inline OOClassArray &operator = ( NSMutableArray *val ) { set( val ); return *this; };
00408     oo_inline OOClassArray &operator = ( OOClassArray *val ) { set( val.get() ); return *this; };
00409     oo_inline OOClassArray<CNAME> operator ~ () {
00410         OOClassArray<CNAME> save = this->get();
00411         detruct();
00412         return save;
00413     }
00414 };
00415 
00416 /**
00417  NSMutable dictionary wrapper for storing heap allocated C++ instances by key.
00418  
00419  Usage:
00420  <pre>
00421  OOClassDict<aclass> a
00422  a[@"KEY"] = new aclass[];
00423  ~a[@"KEY"] // instance deleted
00424  </pre>
00425  */
00426 
00427 template <typename CNAME>
00428 class OOClassDict : public OODictionary<OOClassPtr<CNAME> > {
00429 protected:
00430     // delete each entry to call its detructor
00431     oo_inline NSMutableDictionary *set( NSMutableDictionary *val ) {
00432         NSMutableDictionary *old = !*this ? nil : this->get();
00433         if ( old && val != old && [old retainCount] == 1 ) {
00434 #if 0000
00435             for ( id key in [old allKeys] )
00436                 ~(*this)[key];
00437 #else
00438             OOArray<id> keys = [old allKeys];
00439             for ( int i=0 ; i<keys ; i++ )
00440                 ~(*this)[*keys[i]];
00441 #endif
00442         }
00443         return OODictionary<OOClassPtr<CNAME> >::set( val );
00444     }
00445     oo_inline void detruct() { set( nil ); }
00446 public:
00447     oo_inline OOClassDict() {}
00448     oo_inline OOClassDict( NSMutableDictionary *val ) { set( val ); }
00449     oo_inline OOClassDict( const OOClassDict &val ) { set( val.get() ); }
00450     oo_inline ~OOClassDict() { this->detruct(); }
00451 
00452     oo_inline OOClassDict &operator = ( NSMutableArray *val ) { this->set( val ); return *this; };
00453     oo_inline OOClassDict &operator = ( const OOClassDict &val ) { this->set( val.get() ); return *this; };
00454     oo_inline OOClassDict<CNAME> operator ~ () {
00455         OOClassDict<CNAME> save = this->get();
00456         detruct();
00457         return save;
00458     }
00459 };
